enter_url: Enter the URL you want to manually add to the database
loading: Data is being retrieved from the server.
new_playlist_name: Enter a name for the new playlist
no_content_filter: No items found for the current filter/search conditions.
queue_radio_based_on: The queue is dynamically filled with tracks based on:

settings.need_help_setup_provider: Need help setting up this provider ?
settings.no_providers_detail: Start your Music Assistant experience by adding your Music providers below.
settings.provider_name: Custom name for this provider entry
settings.sync_running: This provider is now being synchronized

log_level.label: Log level
log_level.description: Set the log verbosity for this provider.

flow_mode.label: Enable queue flow mode
flow_mode.description:
Enable "flow" mode where all queue tracks are sent as a continuous audio stream.
Use for players that do not natively support gapless and/or crossfading or if the player has trouble transitioning between tracks.

auto_play.label: Automatically play (resume on power on)
auto_play.description: When this player is turned ON, automatically start playing (if there are items in the queue).

output_channels.label: Output Channel Mode
output_channels.description: You can configure this player to play only the left or right channel, for example to create a stereo pair with 2 players.

volume_normalization.label: Enable volume normalization (EBU-R128 based)
volume_normalization.description: Enable volume normalization based on the EBU-R128 standard without affecting dynamic range

volume_normalization_target.label: Target level for volume normalization
volume_normalization_target.description:
Adjust average (perceived) loudness to this target level, default is -17 LUFS

**WARNING:** Setting the level too high may result in clipping!

eq_bass.label: Equalizer: bass
eq_bass.description: Use the built-in basic equalizer to adjust the bass (low tones) level of the audio.

eq_mid.label: Equalizer: mid
eq_mid.description: Use the built-in basic equalizer to adjust the mid level of audio.

eq_treble.label: Equalizer: treble
eq_treble.description: Use the built-in basic equalizer to adjust the treble (high tones) level of audio.

crossfade.label: Enable crossfade
crossfade.description: Enable a crossfade transition between (queue) tracks.

crossfade_duration.label: Crossfade duration
crossfade_duration.description: Duration in seconds of the crossfade between tracks (if enabled)

hide_player.label: Hide this player in the user interface
hide_player.description:
Hide this player in the user interface.

Note that it can still be controlled and it will also show up in any sync groups the player belongs to.

default_enqueue_select_artist.label: Items to select when you play an (in-library) artist.
default_enqueue_select_artist.description: If you want to play an artist, what items should be enqueued?

options.library_album_tracks: All tracks from all albums in the library
options.all_album_tracks: All tracks from all albums from (all) provider(s)

default_enqueue_select_album.label: Items to select when you play an (in-library) album.
default_enqueue_select_album.description: If you want to play an album, what items should be enqueued?

options.all_tracks: All tracks for album on provider

default_enqueue_action_artist.label: Default enqueue option for Artist item(s).
default_enqueue_action_artist.description: Define the default enqueue action for this media type (if you did not specify an action).

options.play: Play artist track(s) now and keep the remaining queue item(s).
options.replace: Clear the queue and play the artist track(s)
options.next: Play the item(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.replace_next: Clear the queue and play the artist track(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.add: Add the artist track(s) at the end of the queue.

default_enqueue_action_album.label: Default enqueue option for Album item(s).
default_enqueue_action_album.description: Define the default enqueue action for this media type (if you did not specify an action).

options.play: Play album track(s) now and keep the remaining queue item(s).
options.replace: Clear the queue and play the album track(s)
options.next: Play the item(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.replace_next: Clear the queue and play the album track(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.add: Add the album track(s) at the end of the queue.

default_enqueue_action_track.label: Default enqueue option for Track item(s).
default_enqueue_action_track.description: Define the default enqueue action for this media type (if you did not specify an action).

options.play: Play track(s) now and keep the remaining queue item(s).
options.replace: Clear the queue and play the track(s).
options.next: Play the track(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.replace_next: Clear the queue and play the track(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.add: Add the track(s) at the end of the queue.

default_enqueue_action_playlist.label: Default enqueue option for Playlist item(s).
default_enqueue_action_playlist.description: Define the default enqueue action for this media type (if you did not specify an action).

options.play: Play playlist track(s) now and keep the remaining queue item(s).
options.replace: Clear the queue and play the playlist track(s)
options.next: Play the item(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.replace_next: Clear the queue and play the playlist track(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.add: Add the playlist track(s) at the end of the queue.

default_enqueue_action_radio.label: Default enqueue option for Radio item(s).
default_enqueue_action_radio.description: Define the default enqueue action for this media type (if you did not specify an action).

options.play: Play radio station now and keep the remaining queue item(s).
options.replace: Clear the queue and play the radio station
options.next: Play the item(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.replace_next: Clear the queue and play the radio station(s) right after the currently played/buffered item.
options.add: Add the radio station(s) at the end of the queue.

settings.provider_depends_on_confirm: Before you can set up {0}, you need to have the {1} provider configured, do you want to do that now?

tts_pre_announce.label: Pre-announce TTS announcements
tts_pre_announce.description: When a TTS (text-to-speech) message is sent to the Announce feature, prepend the announcement with a short pre-announcement sound (bell whistle).

announce_volume_strategy.label: Volume strategy for Announcements
announce_volume_strategy.description: When an announcement is being broadcast to this player, how should the volume be adjusted temporarily (use in combination with the volume value below)?

announce_volume.label: Volume for Announcements
announce_volume.description: The percentual, relative or absolute volume level, used with the strategy for announcements.

announce_volume_min.label: Minimum Volume level for Announcements
announce_volume_min.description: The volume (adjustment) of announcements should not go below this level.

announce_volume_max.label: Maximum Volume level for Announcements
announce_volume_max.description: The volume (adjustment) of announcements should not go above this level.

icon.label: Icon
icon.description:
Material design icon for this player.

See https://pictogrammers.com/library/mdi/.

settings.frontend_desc: Configuration settings for the Music Assistant User Interface (frontend). Note that these settings are stored at a device level.

menu_items.label: Enabled menu items
menu_items.description:
Configure which items to show in the menu.

Note that if you disable the settings you may lock yourself out.

To gain access again, you will need to manually enter the path to the settings or clear the browser cookies. Use at your own risk!

hide_settings.label: Hide settings button
hide_settings.description:
Hide the settings button on the home screen.

Note that if you disable the settings on the home screen and in the menu you may lock yourself out.

To gain access again, you will need to manually enter the path to the settings or clear the browser cookies. Use at your own risk!

settings.no_music_providers_detail: Start your Music Assistant experience by adding your Music providers.
settings.no_player_providers_detail: Configure player providers to select devices where Music Assistant can output your music.

volume_normalization_radio.label: Volume normalization method to use for radio streams
volume_normalization_radio.description:
Set the preferred volume normalization strategy for radio streams. 
By default Music Assistant collects a measurement of the radio station's (average perceived) loudness according to the EBU-R128 specification and then adjusts the overall gain/volume of the stream according to that measurement so the dynamic range of the audio is not affected. When no measurement (yet) exists for a radio station, Music Assistant will fallback to a dynamic (but less accurate) loudness levelling filter.

TIP: Radio streams often have varying loudness levels, especially during announcements and commercials.
You can choose to enforce dynamic volume normalization to radio streams, even if a (average) loudness measurement for the radio station exists. 
 
**Options:**

 - Disabled - do not apply volume normalization at all for radio streams. 
  - Force dynamic - Enforce dynamic volume levelling at all times. 
  - Measurement only (no fallback) - Apply (overall) volume/gain correction based on stored measurement. If we do not have any measurement, do not apply normalization.
  - Fallback to gain correction - Apply (overall) volume/gain correction based on stored measurement. If we do not have any measurement, fallback to a predefined gain correction.
 - Fixed gain correction - Always apply the fixed volume/gain correction.
  - Fallback to dynamic - Automatically pick the best option: Apply (overall) volume/gain correction based on stored measurement if we have any, allow fallback to dynamic mode if no measurement is available.

volume_normalization_tracks.label: Volume normalization method to use for tracks
volume_normalization_tracks.description:
Set the preferred volume normalization strategy for tracks/songs.
Music Assistant uses a measurement of the tracks's (average perceived) loudness according to the EBU-R128 specification to adjust the overall gain/volume of the stream without affecting the dynamic range of the audio.
These measurements are either provided by the streaming provider or in case of local files, can be contained in the ID3 tags (ReplayGain 2.0 / Opus R128).
If the measurement is not provided, Music Assistant will automatically perform a measurement when/after the track is (first) played. When no measurement (yet) exists for a track, Music Assistant will by default fallback to a dynamic (but less accurate) loudness levelling filter. This ensures no big spikes/falls in the volume level between tracks, even if there is no accurate measurement yet but the dynamic leveler can sometimes compress the dynamic range a bit, although that should not be audible in most cases.


**Options:**

 - Disabled - do not apply volume normalization at all for radio streams.
 - Force dynamic - Enforce dynamic volume levelling at all times. 
 - Measurement only (no fallback) - Apply (overall) volume/gain correction based on stored measurement. If we do not have any measurement, do not apply normalization. 
 - Fallback to gain correction - Apply (overall) volume/gain correction based on stored measurement. If we do not have any measurement, fallback to a predefined gain correction. 
 - Fixed gain correction - Always apply the fixed volume/gain correction. 
 - Fallback to dynamic - Automatically pick the best option: Apply (overall) volume/gain correction based on stored measurement if we have any, allow fallback to dynamic mode if no measurement is available.

volume_normalization_fixed_gain_tracks.label: Fixed/fallback gain adjustment for tracks
volume_normalization_fixed_gain_tracks.description:
Fixed/fallback gain correction to apply to a track audio stream (depends on the 'Volume normalization method' setting).
Use a positive value to increase the volume, a negative value to decrease the volume.

This setting is used when the volume normalization method is set to 'Fixed gain correction' or 'Fallback to gain correction'.

volume_normalization_fixed_gain_radio.label: Fixed/fallback gain adjustment for radio
volume_normalization_fixed_gain_radio.description:
Fixed/fallback gain correction to apply to a radio stream (depends on the 'Volume normalization method' setting).
Use a positive value to increase the volume, a negative value to decrease the volume.

This setting is used when the volume normalization method is set to 'Fixed gain correction' or 'Fallback to gain correction'.

settings.add_group_player_desc: For a group player created for the {0} provider, a syncgroup will be automatically created, meaning that if you play to this Player Group, the member players will be automatically synchronized.
settings.add_group_player_desc_universal:
By creating a Universal Player Group, you can group players from different providers/ecosystems together. 
This will distribute the same audio to all member players (but not in sync).

dynamic_members.label: Dynamic group members
dynamic_members.description: Allow members to (temporarily) join/leave the group dynamically, so the group more or less behaves the same as manually syncing players together, with the main difference being that the group player will hold the queue.

dsp.disabled_message: DSP is currently disabled. Enable it using the switch above

parametric_eq.edited_channel: Plot the EQs response for this channel(s)
parametric_eq.channel: This band will be applied to

presets.name: Preset Name
presets.remove_confirm: Are you sure you want to remove this DSP preset?

power_control.label: Power control
power_control.description:
Define/override the power control behavior for this player.
It allows you for example to redirect the power on/off commands to a different appliance, or use a fake power control if your player does not support power on/off commands but you like to have a dedicated state for a player not in use.

volume_control.label: Volume control
volume_control.description:
Define/override the volume control behavior for this player.
It allows you for example to redirect the volume control commands to a different appliance, or disable it completely.

mute_control.label: Mute control
mute_control.description:
Define/override the mute control behavior for this player.
It allows you for example to redirect the muting control commands to a different appliance, or disable it completely.

We offer a 'fake' mute control option, which will simulate muting by setting the volume to 0 and restoring the volume when unmuting.

output_limiter.label: Enable limiting to prevent clipping
output_limiter.description: Activates a limiter that prevents audio distortion by making loud peaks quieter.

dsp_note_multi_device_group.label: You can configure the DSP for each player individually.

dsp_note_multi_device_group_unsupported.label: This group type does not support DSP when playing to multiple devices.

enable_builtin_player.label: Allow playback to this device/browser
enable_builtin_player.description: Enable the (experimental) built-in player for this device/browser, which allows you to stream all Music Assistant content directly to this device.

sync_running: One or more music providers are being synchronized.

tooltip.refresh_new_content: New content is available, click to refresh the listing
tooltip.open_provider_link: Open this item on the provider's website
tooltip.loading: The server is processing a request or syncing music.
tooltip.primary_image: This is the primary image for this image type

confirm_library_remove: Are you sure you want to delete this item from the library? Any items depending on this item will also be recursively removed. Note that this will only remove this item from the library. If this is a music file on disk, it may return on the next sync.
item_in_library: This item is available in the library
image_url: Input the URL to an image or icon (optional)
background_task_added: The action is performed by the server in the background and may take some time to complete. Keep an eye on the server log for progress.
item_fully_played: This item has been fully played
item_in_progress: This item has been partially played

mode.dynamic: Volume normalization is active in the dynamic mode.
mode.measurement_only: Volume normalization is active based on a stored measurement of the (integrated) loudness of the audio.
mode.measurement_album: Volume normalization is active based on a stored measurement of the (integrated) loudness of the album.
mode.fixed_gain: Volume normalization is active based on fixed gain correction.

streamdetails.output_format_pcm_info: Audio is passed as PCM to the player provider. The player provider may then convert the audio to a different format before sending it to the player.
